attributes.name: empty-text
attributes.desc: text displayed when data is void

attributes.name: [props](#props)
attributes.desc: configuration options, see the following table

attributes.name: expand-on-click-node
attributes.desc: whether to expand or collapse node when clicking on the node, if false, then expand or collapse node only when clicking on the arrow icon.

attributes.name: check-on-click-node
attributes.desc: whether to check or uncheck node when clicking on the node, if false, the node can only be checked or unchecked by clicking on the checkbox.

attributes.name: check-on-click-leaf
attributes.desc: whether to check or uncheck node when clicking on leaf node (last children).(2.9.6)

attributes.name: default-expanded-keys
attributes.desc: array of keys of initially expanded nodes

attributes.name: check-strictly
attributes.desc: whether checked state of a node not affects its father and child nodes when show-checkbox is true

attributes.name: default-checked-keys
attributes.desc: array of keys of initially checked nodes

attributes.name: filter-method
attributes.desc: this function will be executed on each node when use filter method. if return false, tree node will be hidden.
attributes.optionValue: (query: string, data: TreeNodeData, node: TreeNode) => boolean

attributes.name: indent
attributes.desc: horizontal indentation of nodes in adjacent levels in pixels

props.name: value
props.desc: unique identity key name for nodes, its value should be unique across the whole tree

props.name: label
props.desc: specify which key of node object is used as the node's label

props.name: children
props.desc: specify which node object is used as the node's subtree

props.name: disabled
props.desc: specify which key of node object represents if node's checkbox is disabled

props.name: class
props.optionValue: (data: TreeNodeData, node: TreeNode) => string | {[key: string]: boolean}

slots.name: empty ^(2.9.0)
slots.desc: custom content when data is empty

events.name: @node-click
events.desc: triggers when a node is clicked

events.name: @node-drop
events.desc: triggers when drag something and drop on a node(2.8.3)

events.name: @node-contextmenu
events.desc: triggers when a node is clicked by right button

events.name: @check-change
events.desc: triggers when the selected state of the node changes

events.name: @check
events.desc: triggers after clicking the checkbox of a node
events.param: (data: TreeNodeData, info: { checkedKeys: TreeKey[,checkedNodes: TreeData, halfCheckedKeys: TreeKey[, halfCheckedNodes: TreeData,})

methods.name: filter
methods.desc: filter all tree nodes, filtered nodes will be hidden

methods.name: getCheckedNodes
methods.desc: If the node can be selected (`show-checkbox` is `true`), it returns the currently selected array of nodes

methods.name: getCheckedKeys
methods.desc: If the node can be selected (`show-checkbox` is `true`), it returns the currently selected array of node's keys

methods.name: setCheckedKeys
methods.desc: set certain nodes to be checked

methods.name: setChecked
methods.desc: set node to be checked or not

methods.name: setExpandedKeys
methods.desc: set certain nodes to be expanded

methods.name: getHalfCheckedNodes
methods.desc: If the node can be selected (`show-checkbox` is `true`), it returns the currently half selected array of nodes

methods.name: getHalfCheckedKeys
methods.desc: If the node can be selected (`show-checkbox` is `true`), it returns the currently half selected array of node's keys

methods.name: getCurrentKey
methods.desc: return the highlight node's key (undefined if no node is highlighted)

methods.name: getCurrentNode
methods.desc: return the highlight node's data (undefined if no node is highlighted)

methods.name: getNode
methods.desc: get node by key or data

methods.name: setData
methods.desc: When the data is very large, using reactive data will cause the poor performance, so we provide a way to avoid this situation

methods.name: scrollToNode
methods.desc: scroll to a given tree key with specified scroll strategy(2.8.0)
methods.param: (key: TreeKey, strategy?: auto | smart | center | start | end)
